note: Questions requiring drawing input are stored here separately. These questions will be re-enabled when the application supports drawing capabilities.

questions.diagramDescription: Empty Cartesian coordinate plane with x and y axes.

parts.questionText: Sketch the graph of $y=3^{-x}$ on the axes below. Indicate clearly the coordinates of the points where the graph crosses the axes.

questions.stem: The diagram below shows a triangle ABC.

parts.questionText: Construct the perpendicular bisector of AC.
Construct the bisector of angle BCA.

questions.stem: A liquid container, 30 cm tall, can be modelled by a frustrum, A, placed below a cylinder B, as shown in Figure 1. Figure 2 shows a sketch of the cone that the frustum A is a part of. The diameter QRS of the top of the frustrum, is 12 cm and the diameter VUT of the bottom is 8 cm. The height of the frustrum, RU is 9 cm. R and U are the midpoints of QS and VT respectively.
questions.diagramDescription: Figure 1 shows a liquid container, 30 cm tall, composed of a frustum (A, height 9 cm) below a cylinder (B). Figure 2 shows the frustum A as part of a larger cone with height 9 cm for the frustum and diameters 12 cm (top) and 8 cm (bottom), with the dashed lines completing the cone to a vertex W.

parts.questionText: Calculate the volume of the frustrum, A.

A liquid is poured into the container at a constant rate of $q~cm^{3}$ per second. It takes 50 seconds to fill up A completely and it takes another 30 seconds to fill up B completely. Sketch the height of the liquid in the container with respect to time.

questions.stem: The variables x and y are connected by the equation $y=2x+\frac{6}{x}-7$. Some corresponding values of x and y are given in the table below.
questions.diagramDescription: Table of values for $y=2x+\frac{6}{x}-7$: x values are 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7. Corresponding y values are 6, 1, 0, a, 1, 2.5, 4.2, 6, 7.9. A grid for drawing the graph of $y=2x+\frac{6}{x}-7$ for $0.5\le x\le7$ is provided.

parts.questionText: Calculate the value of a.
On the grid, draw the graph of $y=2x+\frac{6}{x}-7$ for $0.5\le x\le7$.
The point A has coordinates (3,-1). A tangent to the curve can be drawn so that the tangent passes through A. On the same grid draw this tangent.
Find the equation of this tangent.
By drawing a suitable straight line on your graph, explain why the equation $3x^{2}-8x+6=0$ has no solution for $0.5\le x\le7$.
Complete the table of values for $y=\frac{1}{x-1}+x-1$. (Missing value for x=3.5)
On the grid opposite, draw the graph for $y=\frac{1}{x-1}+x-1$ for $-2\le x\le4$.
The point P has the coordinates (-1, 2). A tangent to the curve can be drawn so that the tangent passes through P and its gradient <0. Draw this tangent on the same grid.
Find the equation of this tangent.
By drawing an appropriate line, use your graph to solve the equation $\frac{1}{x-1}-\frac{1}{4}x=0$ in the range $-2\le x\le4$.

questions.stem:
$\epsilon = \{ \text{integer } x : 0 < x < 12 \}$
$A = \{ \text{prime numbers} \}$
$B = \{ \text{numbers that have at least 2 distinct factors} \}$

parts.questionText: Explain why A is a proper subset of B without listing down the elements.
Draw a Venn diagram and list down the elements to illustrate the above information.

questions.title: Sets and Venn Diagrams

questions.diagramDescription: Blank Cartesian axes with y-axis vertical and x-axis horizontal.

parts.questionText: Sketch the graph of $y=(2+x)(x-6)$ on the axes below. Indicate clearly the values where the graph crosses the axes and write down the equation of the line of symmetry.

questions.title: Sketching Quadratic Graph

questions.diagramDescription: Blank grid with x and y axes for plotting the graph.

parts.questionText: Complete the table of values.
On the grid opposite, draw the graph of $y=\frac{2}{x^{2}}-2x$ for $-3\le x\le3$.

(i) On the same grid, draw the graph of $y+x=6$ for $-3\le x\le3$.
(ii) Write down the x-coordinates of the points where the line intersects the curve.
(iii) These values of x are solutions of the equation $x^{3}+Ax^{2}+B=0$. Find the value of A and of B.

questions.title: Plotting Rational Functions

questions.diagramDescription: Two intersecting circles labelled A and B within a rectangle labeled with the universal set symbol.

parts.questionText: On the Venn diagram, shade the region that represents $A^{\prime}\cup B$.

Use set notation to describe the shaded region. [Note: Diagram shows a shaded annulus-like region where the intersection of A and B is unshaded, and the region outside A is unshaded, implying the shaded part is $A \cap B'$ or similar depending on interpretation of the specific diagram provided in the paper, but based on standard questions it asks to describe a given shaded region]

questions.title: Venn Diagram Shading

parts.questionText: Complete the table of values.
On the grid opposite, draw the graph of $y=\frac{x^{3}}{4}-2x+1$ for $-3\le x\le3$.
Explain how your graph shows that there is only one solution of the equation $\frac{x^{3}}{4}-2x+1=k$ for some values of k.

The equation $x^{3}-9x-4=0$ can be solved by drawing a suitable straight line on the grid. (i) Find the equation of the straight line. (ii) By drawing this straight line, solve the equation $x^{3}-9x-4=0$.
